reviewText:
Good program on the problems and progress in the construction of this amazing bridge. You are right up there 300 feet above the water in Charleston Harbor when the concrete mix is found to be to hard to pour, when the wrong piece of platform is welded in place, and so on.

Computerized models show the plans, the footings, the earthquake-resistance aspects, and the dumping of acres of Canadian granite around the footers to protect against ships running into it. Very interesting.
